other_tests.findings: Reduced amplitudes (approximately 60% of normal) and prolonged latencies (approximately 40 ms increased) on flash VEP; reduced acuity on spatial-sweep VEP testing.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Improved amplitudes (approximately 82% for right eye; approximately 74% for left eye) and latencies in both eyes after riboflavin supplementation.

other_tests.findings: Lacked a well-defined posterior dominant rhythm suggestive of mild generalized cerebral dysfunction.
Small median compound muscle action potentials (CMAPs) but normal peroneal CMAPs; absent median nerve action potentials from digit 2; small sural nerve action potentials.
Showed small median compound muscle action potentials (CMAPs) and normal peroneal CMAPs.
Normal with the exception of low homovanillic acid and 5-hydroxyindoleacetic acid.
